title: AnalogOutput (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK FINAL AnalogOutput EXTENDS
CommandablePoint
DNP3 datapoint of type Analog Output.
An instance of AnalogOutput does represent an combination of an instance of a datapoint of DNP3 object group 40 âanalog output statusâ
and optionally an instance of a datapoint of DNP3 object group 41 âanalog outputsâ.
AnalogOutput allows for DNP3 master read access and - if needed / configured - also for âcommandingâ that means DNP3 acknowledged master write access (select / operate).
To enable âcommandingâ (in fact the instance of DNP3 object group 41 âanalog outputsâ) set EnableCommand to TRUE.
DNP3 Analog Output provides the option to use certain data types to represent the value (using AnyNumber):
SINT (8bit -128 .. 127)
USINT (16bit 0 .. 255)
INT (16bit -32768 .. 32767)
UINT (16bit 0 .. 65535)
DINT (32bit -2147483648 .. 2147483647)
UDINT (32bit 0 .. 4294967295)
REAL
DOUBLE
Any one of the types listed can be used for value, lowLimit, highLimit and deadBand,
all variables have to be of same base type.
Please be aware:
AnyNumber
provides a value representation as well as a POINTER TO value representation.

rows.Name: Description
rows.Comment:
Description of the datapoint - this is a configuration,
changes are ignored after Outstation was enabled.

rows:
Point number - this is a configuration, changes are ignored after Outstation was enabled..
The point number can be configured if needed to either:start with Point number > 0have gaps in Point numbersIf set to -1 (the default) the OutstationDataModel (more precisely the related âGroupâ) takes care to set the Point number internally:starting at 0, if first Point number is not set explicitly.increment by 1In case you set Point number explicitly please keep it consistent:Point numbers need to be >= 0Point numbers need to be ascending

The initial event class - this is a configuration, changes are ignored after Outstation was enabled.
Operational event class may be changed by a master.

The event mode - this is a configuration, changes are ignored after Outstation was enabled.
Only used if the sampling rate is set within the outstation configuration.

Scan period for datapoint.
If tScanPeriod is set to T#0MS, the Group related tScanPeriod or the OutstationDataModel.tScanPeriod is used.
LoggingOptions can be combined using OR.

rows.Name: flags
rows.Comment:
Flags used by the point. Can be changed in case a point goes offline or any other error.
If set to 0, the variation without flags will be used by DNP3

rows:
Enable / disable commanding (from DNP3 master) - this is a
configuration, changes are ignored after Outstation was
enabled.

The initial command event class - this is a configuration, changes are ignored after Outstation was enabled.
Operational command event class may be changed by a master.

The command event mode - this is a configuration, changes are ignored after Outstation was enabled.
Only used if the sampling rate is set within the outstation configuration.

Reject master commands, only relevant, if EnableCommand is
set to TRUE.

Let the master know, for which reason a command was rejected
(xEnableCommand = FALSE).

Reset an active master command and use local command value again at rising edge (FALSE â> TRUE).
At / after reset, the local command value is used as a resultingValue until next master command.

rows.Name: commandActive
rows.Comment:
A master command was accepted and is active right now.
The command value issued with the master command is used as a resultingValue until a command reset happens - see resetCommand.

rows.Name: EventWithTimeStamp
rows.Comment:
Enable / disable if events will be send with / without
timestamp - this is a configuration, changes are ignored
after Outstation was enabled.

rows:
The command value to use, in most cases using the POINTER TO
value representation is appropriate.
The low limit to operate with - default is -INF
The high limit to operate with - default is +INF.
The deadband to operate with - default is 1.0.
Enable / disable the feedback (or status) value.

Optional feedback (or status) value to use, in most cases using the POINTER TO value representation is appropriate.
If the feedback (or status) value is disabled, the resulting command value will be utilized as feedback value.

rows.Name: resultingValue
rows.Comment:
The resulting command value, results from value or accepted
master command request.
